Noone is going to praise Riot for doing things that they should have done literally almost a decade ago.

It is like being grateful for someone fixing your car 10 years after you wanted it fixed on the warranty.

I don't think it's that as much as it's the fact that they come with the price increase. Those are gonna hurt so getting a refund is a small consolation prize. 

If Riot sold $1000000 worth of RP, with the 10% alone (as some regions are higher) That increases to 1.1 million. Refunds will not dent  that 100k much for 2 reasons. Once RP is purchased Riot already has your money, they don't need you to buy a skin they need you to buy RP.  Second misuse will occur and people will refund cheap skins and BE purchased champions. thus reducing the overall impact of having the refund. 

Maybe I'm looking into it too much. IDK

The community isn't competing to reduce Riot's income. For all we know, the price increases are justified by tax laws and whatnot. I'm not a financial specialist so idk if what is said in the announcement holds water but i'll have to give them the benefit of doubt for now.

Refunds are meant to be used as a way to get back your RP, not your money. They were never a "get your money back" type of thing to begin with. More like a "Choose something else if you want this time" type of thing.

Yeah, but if you think about it. Say player 1 wants 4 skins, but he can only buy 3. However, next week he can get the forth. 

So he buys 3k RP. After obtaining the 3 he then gets lucky and finds a hextech box that contains one of the 3 skins he purchased. Refunds it and buys the 4th skin. Now he has no need to buy more RP as he has all the ones he wants. 
Riot loses a sale. 
There are many more scenarios where refunds transferring to a sale a person actually wants, could reduce over all sales while RP will remain the same. If I don't need to spend more since I refunded that's still a lost sale. 

Hope that makes sense. While this wont be the case with everyone, enough people will get these scenarios and Riot will lose potential sales due to it. Not enough though (IMO) to lose out with the new taxes. 

Justified? Sure Riot really hasn't raised their prices much. I think with the prestige skins and passes, and other money grabs like pajama guardians has left a bad taste in my mouth. Being neutral though, the tax prices are probably needed.
